bug.short_desc: SplitButton does not lose hover state on Modern theme when inside a toolbar w/ padding

long_desc.thetext:
http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/playground/#%7B%22code%22%3A%22%252F%252F%2520Create%2520a%2520button%250Avar%2520button1%2520%253D%2520new%2520qx.ui.form.SplitButton(%2522Bug%2520Button%2522%252C%2520%2522icon%252F22%252Fapps%252Finternet-web-browser.png%2522)%253B%250A%250A%252F%252F%2520Document%2520is%2520the%2520application%2520root%250Avar%2520doc%2520%253D%2520this.getRoot()%253B%250A%250Avar%2520toolbar%2520%253D%2520new%2520qx.ui.toolbar.ToolBar()%253B%250Atoolbar.setPadding(10)%253B%250Atoolbar.add(button1)%253B%250Aqx.theme.manager.Meta.getInstance().setTheme(qx.theme.Modern)%253B%250A%252F%252F%2520Add%2520button%2520to%2520document%2520at%2520fixed%2520coordinates%250Adoc.add(toolbar%252C%250A%257B%250A%2520%2520left%2520%253A%2520100%252C%250A%2520%2520top%2520%2520%253A%252050%250A%257D)%253B%250A%250A%252F%252F%2520Add%2520an%2520event%2520listener%250Abutton1.addListener(%2522execute%2522%252C%2520function(e)%2520%257B%250A%2520%2520alert(%2522Hello%2520World!%2522)%253B%250A%257D)%253B%22%2C%20%22mode%22%3A%22ria%22%7D
Steps to reproduce:
1) Navigate to the above URL
2) hover over the splitbutton
3) move the mouse DIRECTLY up or down out of the splitbutton
4) observe that the splitbutton does not lose the hoverstate
I discovered a workaround for this by editing line 309 of SplitButton.js inside _onMouseOut that works for me, but is untested on any other theme or scenario:
if (qx.ui.core.Widget.contains(this, related)) {
changed to:
if (related != this && qx.ui.core.Widget.contains(this, related)) {
It's strange however that this only occurs in this theme however. Maybe more investigation into the root cause is needed.

While working on a new theme contribution I noticed this bug as well. However, it's neither restricted to a toolbar context nor to the Modern theme, the buggy behaviour seems to apply to SplitButton in general.
BTW: I am using qx 3.5.1.

Thank you for the reporting and for investigating. The problem was, as you mentioned, that child and parent is the same (SplitButton)
I fixed this so Widget.contains returns false when parent and child are initially equal.
Fixed in master with aa24258f0445326baf09cc7b4c1772c219cb2aea and branch_4_0_x with 5d2177c4513b769912805a4a9f6595203cc4fb13
